data.prayer: Lord, you already know the names of the prophets you want to raise up in Bilecik. Please, raise them up and give them the courage to speak your truth to your church.
data.verse: Before I formed you in the womb I knew you, and before you were born I consecrated you; I appointed you a prophet to the nations.

data.location_label: Photo from the state of Bilecik, Turkey
data.section_summary: What needs would people have here?

data.prayer: Father, you said, "The earth belongs to Me and all that is in it". Please, call Bilecik, Turkey into obedience and eternal life.
data.verse: The earth is Yahweh’s, with its fullness; the world, and those who dwell therein.

data.prayer: the state of Bilecik has (about) 78 people who know Jesus, 1,169 people who know about him culturally, and 207,652 people who are far from Jesus.
Spirit, please defend the 78 believers in Bilecik against self-centered spirituality. Open their eyes to the fields ripe for harvest around them.
Father, I pray that the Jew, Turkish people will not be afraid or ashamed. Prevent them from being confounded or disappointed in their search for you. May the Jew, Turkish people know you.
Spirit, give the believers of the the state of Bilecik unity and humility as they work to bring the kingdom to new people and places.
Spirit, please defend the 78 believers in Bilecik against an unwillingness to suffer. Give them courage to face social rejection.

data.section_summary:
the state of Bilecik, Turkey has a population of 208,900.

We estimate Bilecik has 78 people who might know Jesus, 1,169 people who might know about Jesus culturally, and 207,652 people who do not know Jesus.

This is 1 believer for every 2,678 neighbors who need Jesus.

data.prayer: Father, thank you that in your kindness you have made every believer in Bilecik, Turkey a priest, who can offer spiritual sacrifices to you through Jesus.
data.verse: Therefore I tell you that the kingdom of God will be taken away from you and given to a people who will produce its fruit. He who falls on this stone will be broken to pieces, but he on whom it falls will be crushed.”

location.name: Bilecik
location.people_groups_list: Jew, Spanish, Arab, Iraqi, Arab, Lebanese, Adyghe, Kurd, Kurmanji
location.people_groups_list_w_pop: Jew, Spanish (16,000), Arab, Iraqi (112,000), Arab, Lebanese (100,000), Adyghe (350,000), Kurd, Kurmanji (2,200)
